page.title: 17 THE A120
page.content: The A120 starts at Colchester and passes through Coggeshall,Rayne and,finishing at St Albans. The A120 is a Roman road originally named Stane Lane. The road is very fast with a speed limit of 60mph. There is however a 30mph limit going through the village of Rayne but this is not observed and many villagers are worried. In this area the A120 has a grass verge on one side and a narrow pavement on the other. The A120 is heavily used by container lorries because of this the road is very noisy. It is a not a very wide road, being only a single lane carriageway. The A120 provides much trade for the Saling Oak which is sited at Blake End. The Pub has a Diner which caters especilly for the drivers.
